main event: A bright light was observed rising through cirro-stratus clouds in Danville, Illinois on April 25, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed through binoculars at a distance of 1/2 mile to 1 mile., It had a bright light at its base and was believed to be at an altitude of 23,000 feet., The object appeared to be circular and possibly spherical., The object was approximately twice the size of Venus as observed through a telescope., The sighting lasted for about 3 and a half minutes, and there was no distinct shape visible.
sighted object: a bright light rising through the clouds
witness description: an amateur astronomer and member of the Danville Astronomical Society
